page.title: 08Hulands Brick Works
page.content: Hulands Brick Works,owned by Mr.J.M. Wearmouth,occupies 28 acres of land which once belonged to British Rail. The works were built next to Hulands Quarry which is now disused.A railway spur formerly provided transport. The business has been the same size for the past 15 years,producing an average of{100,000 bricks}per week.The works employs 7 men and has 3 lorries used for distribution,which varies from local trade to deliveries as far apart as Berwick in the north,and York and Scarborough to the east.The trucks return with dust and cement for the concrete bricks.They are also used for miscellaneous haulage. In 1985 an up-to-date alarm system was installed.This is an infra-red light-sensitive device to stop the frequent thefts of diesel fuel,wheels and batteries from the lorries.
